meta.description: United Airlines United Club at Washington Dulles International Airport (IAD), Concourse D. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: United Airlines United Club
lounge.description: United Club locations offer a wide range of amenities to make your experience productive and enjoyable. Relax in a sophisticated environment when you wait for your flight in the United Club.

reviews.content: Surprisingly good lounge, ample seating and good breakfast options.
Gold member, would not allow me in unless international flight. Although my ticket is from London / DC / Houston / London. I have been in DC for a week and is only good if international within 24hrs.
Excellent lounge at IAD. Quiet, good food and complimentary drinks.
Plenty of seating in the morning and the fastest internet I’ve seen in a lounge yet (~60-100mbps). Food options limited but full bar (too early for me to try, so can’t comment on bartender). Not bad.
Good food options, basic soup, salad, and snacks. Staff does a great job job keeping things clean and stocked.
No access even if you are first class and a member of Priority Pass.
Standing room only, low on drinks at 4:30pm. Update in October at noon - 3/4 full, F&B the same except they have a pop-up mimosa bar, which is nice. Better than the gate.
Par for the course for UA. Disorganized.  4PM on a Sunday and not a seat to be found. Skip this lounge. Don’t bother with a United lounge membership. You will be very disappointed at most airports.
Standard United offering. Only good if you’re flying from D.
They no longer accept a military ID for access unless you have written orders/leave papers or you are in uniform.
Nice comfortable lounge with good service and plenty of snacks. Biggest issue is cell service. The business rooms have one bar signal for both Verizon and AT&T. A small repeater would go a long way!!
Good space, lots of outlets, tables and chairs. The fridge of drinks is gone, so all drinks come from the bar or coffee machines only.  Bummer, but the cocktails are made right.
Huge empty space - old furnitures, terrible food, alcohol for cash, super depressing.
Quiet w/ prompt, friendly service and tasty food.
This lounge is the least desirable UA lounge at Dulles. It is dim, dark, and crowded, as it serves all of the D gates. The C17 club is a better bet.
Basement United Club with just the bare minimum of everything.
Way too crowded, poor quality food selection.
Average United lounge but better views and space than many others I have used in the US airports. Worth it if you have time and want the wifi, food, and drinks they offer.
Pretty decent size with the usual selection United has to offer. Nice view of the planes from the far corner downstairs.
Great lounge for early morning snacks.
This is a pretty rough domestic lounge. Much worse than the United Club at C17.
Don't expect anything more than a few snacks, a power socket and wi-fi.
A lot more snack and beverage options than Admirals Clubs I've been to. Extremely packed in the afternoon.
Pretty basic united lounge. Crowded at 4:15pm on a Friday. Snacks= pretzels, cookies, cheese and carrots. More beverage choices than some United Lounges.
Nothing special. United, if they cared, which they don't, could learn a lot about running lounges. The should start with Icelandair as a consultant.
Not many snack options at this lounge. However, it might be because I was here mid-day.
This is the usual United Club, and offers the same amenities as most United Clubs. Choose your United Club based on your gate as all clubs are the same.
The usual United domestic lounge with subpar food options. Nothing special about this lounge at all.
If you can found an outlet, this is a decent and cozy lounge.
This lounge is dark, and was overcrowded when I was there.
The ceilings are low, but the lounge is spacious. The lounge offers a good selection of snacks and drinks.
While the ceilings are low and the lighting isn't great, the lounge is clean, large, and has a nice snack selection.
This is a clean, quiet, and comfortable lounge with full snacks and friendly staff. It wasn't too busy when I was here, but I was here mid-day on a Monday.

location.terminalDirections: After security, near the Air France boarding area, close to Gate 22.

otherLounges.name: Etihad Airways Lounge (Chase Sapphire Lounge by The Club)

location.terminalDirections: Located between Concourses A and B, in front of Gate A32 and the main Duty Free Store.
Concourse B, at the top of the escalators after arriving from AeroTrain

otherLounges.name: British Airways The Concorde Dining Room

location.terminalDirections: Near the Lufthansa Departure Gates B49-B51.
Near the Lufthansa Departure Gates B49-B51.
After Security, take the shuttle bus or train to Concourse C. Location is near Gate C14.
On the Arrivals (Baggage Claim) Level, across from Baggage Claim #11 and #12.
Located just past the main security checkpoint.
